foreignData.name: Feenkonklave
foreignData.text:
Die Feenkonklave kommt getappt ins Spiel.
{T}: Erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um ein blaues Mana.
{1}{U}: Die Feenkonklave wird bis zum Ende des Zuges zu einer fliegenden 2/1 Kreatur.
Diese Kreatur zählt immer noch als Land.

mainBoard.name: Faerie Conclave
mainBoard.originalText:
Faerie Conclave comes into play tapped.
oc
T: Add one blue mana to your mana pool.
o1oo
U Faerie Conclave becomes a 2/1 blue creature with flying until end of turn. This creature still counts as a land.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

mainBoard.text:
Faerie Conclave enters tapped.
{T}: Add {U}.
{1}{U}: Faerie Conclave becomes a 2/1 blue Faerie creature with flying until end of turn. It's still a land.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it’s already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

mainBoard.name: Anthroplasm
mainBoard.originalText:
Anthroplasm comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it.
o
X, oc
T: Remove all +1/+1 counters from Anthroplasm and put X +1/+1 counters on it.

rulings.text: While Anthroplasm does become 0/0 for a moment while its ability resolves, state-based actions are not checked until the ability has finished resolving. By that time, it will have some +1/+1 counters on it (assuming X was greater than 0), and so will not be put into its owner’s graveyard.

mainBoard.name: Frantic Search
mainBoard.originalText: Draw two cards, then choose and discard two cards. Untap up to three lands.

rulings.text: You draw two cards and discard two cards all while Frantic Search is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.
You choose which lands to untap as the spell resolves. They aren't targeted, and they don't have to be lands that you control.

mainBoard.text: Draw two cards, then discard two cards. Untap up to three lands.

mainBoard.name: Intervene
mainBoard.originalText: Counter target spell that targets a creature.

rulings.text: If a spell is modal, use the target(s) of the current mode only for this check. Targets for the other modes are never selected.
If the spell’s target leaves the battlefield before this spell resolves, Intervene won’t resolve since it no longer targets a spell that targets a creature.
Intervene can only target a spell that is currently targeting a creature.
It means “targeting at least one creature” not “exactly one creature”.

mainBoard.text: Counter target spell that targets a creature.

mainBoard.name: Rewind
mainBoard.originalText: Counter target spell. Untap up to four lands.

rulings.text: If the spell is an illegal target when Rewind tries to resolve, perhaps because it was countered by another spell or ability, Rewind won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't untap any lands.
Rewind targets only a spell. It doesn't target any lands. The lands are chosen as Rewind resolves.
You can choose up to four lands, no matter who controls any of them. Those lands untap once. You can't choose one land and have it untap four times, for example.

mainBoard.text: Counter target spell. Untap up to four lands.

foreignData.name: Erschöpfung

mainBoard.name: Exhaustion
mainBoard.originalText: Creatures and lands target opponent controls do not untap during his or her next untap phase.

rulings.text: The creatures and lands are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player’s next untap step. They can still can untap during other player’s untap steps.
No creatures or lands controlled by the player will untap during their next untap step. This includes those which entered the battlefield after Exhaustion resolved.

mainBoard.text: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during their next untap step.
